channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Dell admet que l’IA ne fait pas vendre de PC, c’est même l’inverse
item.description: Vous en avez marre qu'on vous colle de l'IA à toutes les sauces ? Vous n'êtes pas seul. Dell s'est rendu compte d'une réalité brutale : le terme « AI PC » ne fait pas vendre. Pire, il embrouille tout le monde.

item.title: Allez vous craquer pour l’un de ces téléviseurs lifestyle Hisense bientôt disponibles ?
item.description: La marque Hisense a profité du CES de Las Vegas pour annoncer la prochaine commercialisation de plusieurs téléviseurs dits « lifestyle ». Comprenez qu’ils proposent des designs particulièrement originaux au détriment d’une fiche technique assez classique.

item.title: The best VPN deals: Up to 88 percent off ProtonVPN, Surfshark, ExpressVPN, NordVPN and more
item.description: It's a new year, and a great time to fulfill your resolution to practice better cybersecurity. The early days of January are a great time to grab a last-minute subscription for yourself or a loved one. With access to a virtual private network (VPN), you can stream TV shows and events from all over the world, protect your information from hackers and thwart online trackers. Although we strongly recommend using a VPN, jumping on the first deal that comes along might get you stuck with a substandard app. Beyond that, even otherwise respectable VPNs sometimes frame their prices in misleading ways...

item.title: Motorola just announced a foldable phone to rival Samsung and Google at CES
item.description: Samsung and Google have new competition in the foldable space. At CES 2026, Motorola unveiled its first side-foldable smartphone: the Razr Fold. The handheld sports an impressive 6.6-inch external screen and an 8.1-inch flexible main display. Motorola hasn’t provided dimensions yet, so we don’t know how thick it is yet or how it compares to other foldables in that respect.We do know, however, that it'll include support for the Moto Pen Ultra stylus. This is actually a fairly big deal, as Samsung dropped the feature for the Z Fold 7. Modern foldables basically double as tablets, so a stylus is ...

item.title: « Le grand public n’achète pas » : Dell admet que l’IA ne fait pas vendre de PC
item.description: Derrière les grands discours fiévreux de l'industrie de la tech qui s'est engouffrée comme un seul homme dans l'IA, il y a une réalité : le grand public n'achète pas un produit parce qu'il y a marqué « IA » dessus. C'est le constat lucide dressé par un dirigeant de Dell.

item.title: If you love thick carpets, Roborock's new hovering robot vacuum is about to become your new cleaning BFF
item.description: It will raise itself to the perfect height to clean without ever getting stuck.

item.title: Hisense veut vous aider à faire la fête en musique en 2026 avec les enceintes nomades Party Storm, FlexBoom, VoyageBoom et WeBoom
item.description: Hisense renforce son catalogue d’enceintes nomades avec une gamme complète pensée pour la maison, les soirées et l’usage outdoor, articulée autour des modèles Party Storm, FlexBoom, VoyageBoom et WeBoom. L’objectif est de couvrir aussi bien les besoins d’animation de grandes fêtes que l’écoute mobile du quotidien.

item.title: How to use a VPN on iPhone
item.description: Installing a virtual private network (VPN) on an iPhone or iPad is easy. The days are gone when Apple users had to be content with the leavings from the Windows ecosystem — in 2026, all the best VPN services have secure, user-friendly iOS apps on par with every other platform. If you've decided to add a VPN to your iPhone to stay anonymous online and change your virtual location, you've got plenty of great choices.Since you're here, chances are you're familiar with the benefits of using a VPN, including security on public Wi-Fi and the ability to explore streaming libraries in other countries....

item.title: Clap de fin pour Realme et OnePlus ? Oppo réorganise toute sa structure en 2026
item.description: Les marques "indépendantes" du groupe BBK, c'est fini. Huit ans après son émancipation, Realme perd son statut d'entreprise autonome pour redevenir une division d'Oppo.

item.title: Election Deniers Think the Venezuela Attack Is All About 2020
item.description: Election deniers are sure that the capture of Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro is proof that the Venezuelan government rigged the 2020 election in Joe Biden’s favor.

item.title: Character.AI and Google settle with families in teen suicide and self-harm lawsuits
item.description: Character.AI and Google have reportedly agreed to settle multiple lawsuits regarding teen suicide and self-harm. According to The Wall Street Journal, the victims' families and the companies are working to finalize the settlement terms.The families of several teens sued the companies in Florida, Colorado, Texas and New York. The Orlando, FL, lawsuit was filed by the mother of 14-year-old Sewell Setzer III, who used a Character.AI chatbot tailored after Game of Thrones' Daenerys Targaryen. The teen reportedly exchanged sexualized messages with the chatbot and occasionally referred to it as "his...

item.title: Lux Capital lands $1.5 billion for its largest fund ever
item.description: The 25-year-old firm is an early investor in Anduril, Applied Intuition and Runway AI.

item.title: The best TVs of CES 2026: brighter OLEDs, 130-inch screens, and RGB mini-LED everywhere
item.description: CES 2026 is a showcase for new TV tech, with RGB mini-LED models from a range of brands looking to bring the fight to OLED's picture quality dominance

item.title: The Vision of 2026 in ‘Metropolis’ Is Spot On
item.description: The 1927 silent classic got a few technology predictions wrong but was scarily on the mark about workers' rights and out-of-touch industry oligarchs.

item.title: Nous Research's NousCoder-14B is an open-source coding model landing right in the Claude Code moment
item.description: Nous Research, the open-source artificial intelligence startup backed by crypto venture firm Paradigm, released a new competitive programming model on Monday that it says matches or exceeds several larger proprietary systems — trained in just four days using 48 of Nvidia's latest B200 graphics processors.The model, called NousCoder-14B, is another entry in a crowded field of AI coding assistants, but arrives at a particularly charged moment: Claude Code, the agentic programming tool from rival Anthropic, has dominated social media discussion since New Year's Day, with developers posting breath...

item.title: Ces lunettes ajustent votre vue automatiquement, et cela sonne la fin du calvaire des verres progressifs
item.description: i vous portez des verres progressifs, vous savez de quoi je vais parler : bouger la tête sans cesse pour trouver la zone de netteté. C'est infernal. La start-up finlandaise Ixi promet de régler ça avec des lunettes capables de faire le point toutes seules. Le prototype pèse 22 grammes, mais il faudra attendre 2027.

item.title: Bételgeuse va-t-elle bientôt devenir une supernova ? Les astronomes ont enfin une réponse
item.description: Entre fin 2019 et début 2020, la supergéante rouge Bételgeuse a montré des signes de faiblesse laissant penser que son explosion inéluctable en supernova à quelques centaines d'années-lumière du Système solaire était peut-être imminente. D'autres hypothèses ont été formulées et récemment de...

item.title: NASA Rockets Toward Artemis 2 Launch With Possible SLS Rollout Next Week
item.description: If the rollout happens on NASA’s current schedule, astronauts could be headed back to the Moon next month.

item.title: Xiaomi YU7 : 1300 km d’autonomie avec ou sans recharge ? Le patron s’explique
item.description: Lei Jun est en colère. Le patron de Xiaomi s'est retrouvé au cœur d'une tempête médiatique après une déclaration sur l'autonomie de son futur SUV, le Xiaomi YU7. On l'accuse de promettre 1300 km sur une seule charge. Sa réponse ? C'est faux, c'est la faute des « trolls », et il a une explication très simple.

item.title: Fujifilm's latest Instax camera looks like a vintage Super 8
item.description:
Fujifilm just revealed the Instax mini Evo Cinema camera, which looks suspiciously like a vintage Super 8. More specifically, it was designed to mimic the Single-8 from 1965, which was a rival unit to the Super 8. Fujifilm's latest device captures video, just like its retro inspiration. Wow, the new FUJIFILM Instax Mini EVO Cinema camera looks nuts.. esp the decade slider thing for the looks. If the cost isn't nuts this could be a must have... Needs to be around $249/299ish to be a hit https://t.co/6w8JPsBxIg pic.twitter.com/plcmNhfyT7— derek morleY (@derekmorley) January 7, 2026
However, th...

item.title: HP's new EliteBoard made me believe in keyboard computers again
item.description: A keyboard computer has always been on my wishlist — that is, a computer where the entire machine was stuffed into a keyboard. Perhaps I caught a glimpse of the Commodore 64 at an impressionable age, but regardless, the idea has always been intriguing to me. At CES 2026, HP is bringing that concept back with the new EliteBoard G1a, which is dubbed a “Next Gen AI PC.”It's an IT administrator's dream: It looks a typical desktop keyboard, but it has the full power of a Copilot+ AI PC inside. You can equip it with Ryzen 5 or 7 CPUs and their embedded Radeon 800 GPUs, up to 64GB of RAM and as much ...

item.title: Edifier dévoile une gamme complète d’enceintes polyvalentes au CES 2026
item.description: Le fabricant chinois Edifier profite du CES 2026 de Las Vegas pour présenter une nouvelle collection d'enceintes actives et de moniteurs de studio.

item.title: AMC previews its new show, ‘The Audacity,’ focused on Silicon Valley
item.description: As one of the show's actors, Billy Magnussen, noted, "Silicon Valley is one of those times in our modern era which is defining humanity. And what better place to make a dark comedy than in that place that develops our society at this point?"

item.title: The Trump administration just gave the food pyramid a Sweetgreen makeover
item.description: The government redesigned America’s food guidelines for the MAHA era. President Donald Trump’s administration has introduced a new, inverted food pyramid with fewer food groups.

item.title: L’Oréal’s latest flat iron uses infrared light to make hair styling much faster
item.description: Hair gadgets have become increasingly popular over the last decade. Hair dryers, curlers, steamers - you name it, there's probably a TikTokker shilling for the latest hair gadget that will totally revolutionize a hair routine. Even so, I was excited to get a demo of L'Oréal's Light Straight at CES 2026. It's an extension of […]

item.title: NWS AI-Generated Weather Predictions Are Making Up New Towns
item.description: Expect rain in Whata Bod.

item.title: PS5 Hyperpop : voici les nouveaux coloris et manettes DualSense en édition limitée
item.description: Sony vient d'officialiser trois nouveaux coloris pour la PS5 Slim et la manette DualSense. Baptisée "Hyperpop", cette collection mise sur des dégradés flashy rouge, vert et bleu. C'est joli, c'est officiel, mais l'addition est salée.

item.title: GameStop says CEO compensation package doesn’t include any guaranteed pay
item.description: CEO Ryan Cohen won’t receive any guaranteed pay, which it defines as no salary, no cash bonuses, and no stock that simply vests over time. GameStop is providing details on a new compensation package for CEO Ryan Cohen that is dependent on him meeting certain “significant” performance targets.

item.title: Non, Word et Excel ne vont pas disparaître : Microsoft met fin à la panique
item.description: Depuis 24 heures, les réseaux sociaux s'enflamment : Microsoft aurait tué la marque Office pour la remplacer par Microsoft 365 Copilot. C'est faux. Word et Excel vont bien. Mais derrière cette fake news virale se cache un vrai problème de communication chez Microsoft.

item.title: CES 2026 day 3: the 11 best gadgets we've seen today, from IKEA smart lights to the Motorola Razr Fold
item.description: The news, announcements, and discoveries from CES 2026 are continuing – here are our picks from Day 3.

item.title: Xgimi Titan Noir Max : vers encore plus de contraste pour ce vidéoprojecteur haut de gamme
item.description: Au CES 2026, Xgimi dévoile le Titan Noir Max, un projecteur 4K laser qui mise sur un système de double iris dynamique pour renforcer le contraste et la profondeur des noirs, avec l’ambition de rivaliser avec les références du home cinéma haut de gamme.

item.title: Crédit auto : ce taux imbattable à 1 % que les banques réservent désormais à certains conducteurs
item.description: Les banques redoublent d'efforts pour séduire les automobilistes tentés par l'électrique. Entre taux préférentiels et nouvelles primes, certaines banques dégainent un sacré arsenal financier, dont le taux à 1 %. Mais ces offres sont-elles vraiment avantageuses pour tous les profils d'acheteurs ?

item.title: Pénurie de cartes graphiques : c’est une « bonne idée », Nvidia confirme envisager le retour des anciennes GeForce
item.description: Alors que la pénurie de mémoire frappe le CES 2026 de plein fouet, le patron de Nvidia confirme les rumeurs : ressortir les anciennes GeForce est une « bonne idée ». Oui, la RTX 3060 pourrait bien faire son grand retour, mais avec un twist inattendu.

item.title: What’s Going on With Smart Rings?
item.description: Ultrahuman smart rings currently can’t be sold in the US. We caught up with the company’s chief business officer to discuss what’s next for ring-based health tracking.

item.title: Voici les grands perdants et les gagnants de la réforme solaire en France au 1er trimestre 2026
item.description: Si de fortes baisses ont été appliquées l’an dernier aux dispositifs d’aide à l’installation de panneaux solaires, ce premier trimestre 2026, les montants sont maintenus stables pour les installations résidentielles en France. Pour les systèmes de plus forte puissance, en revanche, la tendance à la baisse se poursuit. Voici les détails.

item.title: Discord’s IPO could happen in March
item.description: Discord reportedly filed confidential IPO paperwork and has pinned its hopes on a debut in March.

item.title: Shopify competitor Swap raises $100M six months after raising $40M
item.description: VC firms DST Global and Iconiq are piling into e-commerce startup Swap Commerce, which is going up against Shopify.

item.title: Smart Glasses With ‘Pet Translation’ Smell Like Total BS
item.description: There's vaporware, and then there's this.

item.title: Growth, not efficiency, is the new AI goal
item.description: ITDMs aren't too worried about productivity – they think AI's true value is in unlocking extra revenue and innovation.

item.title: The Shine 2.0 is a compact wind turbine for your next camping trip
item.description: As power gets more dicey, personal energy generation only gets more appealing. Shine’s compact turbine isn’t going to power your house any time soon (though the company’s co-founder told me they have plans in that direction) but it can suck up the energy required to refill a smartphone in as little as 17 minutes. Of course, what it can generate depends on wind speed. That same charge could take as long as 11 hours if there’s only a slight breeze. That power curve, and its ability to operate at night, sets the turbine apart from solar panels. Of course, on a completely still day, the Shine as ...

item.title: Octopus Prime: Inside a growing and controversial farming effort
item.description: Octopuses are brilliant, emotional, and mysterious. Can they ever be farmed humanely? And if they can, should they be? Fast Company contributor Clint Rainey is the first journalist in the world to be let inside a cutting-edge effort to build the first commercial octopus farm. Read the full story here. Exclusive documentary coming in 2026. Octopuses are brilliant, emotional, and mysterious. Can they ever be farmed humanely? And if they can, should they be? ...

item.title: ASUS and XREAL teamed up at CES to make gaming smartglasses with two important upgrades
item.description: The latest generation of smartglasses can create huge virtual screens without the need to lug around giant monitors are a real boon to frequent travelers. However, their specs aren’t often tailored to the needs of gamers, so at CES 2026, ASUS and XREAL partnered to make a pair with two very important features you don’t normally get from rivals. The new ROG XREAL R1 AR glasses are based on the existing XREAL One Pro, so naturally they share a lot of the same components and specs including dual micro-OLED displays with a per-eye resolution of 1,920 x 1,080, three degrees of freedom (natively), 7...

item.title: Ne parlez plus de robots : l’industrie a honte de ce mot, alors elle a inventé « Physical AI »
item.description: Au CES 2026, le mot "robot" est devenu tabou. À la place ? Tout le monde parle de Physical AI. Une simple pirouette pour nous vendre des aspirateurs et des humanoïdes sans faire peur ? Pas seulement. Derrière ce changement de nom, il y a une vraie révolution technique pilotée par Nvidia.

item.title: Samsung’s Ballie robot is probably never coming out
item.description: Samsung's spherical Ballie robot may be rolling off into the sunset, less than a year after its retail launch was announced. The smart home robot has made an appearance at CES almost every year since it was first announced in 2020, but was notably absent at CES 2026. Unfortunately, its disappearance may be because Ballie […]

item.title: Poison-Laced Arrows Date Back Tens of Thousands of Years Earlier Than Expected
item.description: The use of poisoned weapons 60,000 years ago would have required big brain power.

item.title: Our Latest Look at ‘The Mandalorian and Grogu’ Sure Is a Picture of the Mandalorian and Grogu
item.description: As we wait for a second trailer for the upcoming 'Star Wars' movie, a new photo has arrived.

item.title: AI Models Are Starting to Learn by Asking Themselves Questions
item.description: An AI model that learns without human input—by posing interesting queries for itself—might point the way to superintelligence.

item.title: OpenAI launches ChatGPT Health, encouraging users to connect their medical records
item.description: OpenAI has been dropping hints this week about AI's role as a "healthcare ally" - and today, the company is announcing a product to go along with that idea: ChatGPT Health. ChatGPT Health is a sandboxed tab within ChatGPT that's designed for users to ask their health-related questions in what it describes as a more […]

item.title: The psychology of the ‘Chicken Little’ coworker
item.description: For some, a sudden catch-up invite with the boss equates to ‘I’m getting fired.’ Why—and what gets us out of the mental trap? Everybody knows this coworker—the one who spirals about cost-cutting layoffs when snacks vanish from the break room. The one who thinks they’re getting fired because their boss hasn’t been using emojis with them lately. The one who’s the office Chicken Little: anxious, somewhat frantic, often misguided . . . and who can’t stop talking to others about whatever it is they’re anxious about....

item.title: Job openings drop to 2nd lowest level in 5 years in November
item.description: The number of job postings in November was the fewest since September 2024. U.S. employers posted far fewer jobs in November than the previous month, a sign that employers aren’t yet ramping up hiring even as growth has picked up.

item.title: Les 3 meilleurs écouteurs Bluetooth de 2025, testés et approuvés
item.description: L'année 2025 a été un excellent millésime pour les écouteurs et les casques. Entre des mises à jour très attendues et de nouveaux produits qui cassent les prix, les sorties étaient nombreuses. Nous avons testé moult modèles en 2025 : voici les trois références d'écouteurs sans fil qui se sont démarquées.

item.title: AMD says its Instinct MI500 AI Accelerator will come in 2027 — but is it too late with Nvidia set to introduce Vera-Rubin in 2026?
item.description: AMD details Instinct MI500 architecture and memory plans ahead of the AI accelerator's 2027 debut.

item.title: Brunswick's latest boats at CES 2026 feature edge AI, self-docking capabilities and solar power
item.description: If you've never docked a boat before, consider yourself lucky. There are plenty of popular TikTok channels devoted to shaming those who bring their craft back home clumsily or berth them with something less than finesse. Tricky crosswinds, unpredictable surf and even the jeers of passersby can make it a stressful experience at the best of times.Brunswick, which owns more than 50 water-borne brands like Sea Ray, Bayliner and Mercury Marine, has a solution. It's demonstrating some self-docking tech called AutoCaptain at CES 2026 that makes this process a cinch, plus a fleet of other innovations ...

item.title: Where VCs think AI startups can win, even with OpenAI in the game
item.description: Vanessa Larco, partner at Premise and former partner at NEA, thinks 2026 will finally be the year of consumer AI. Larco, who’s been investing in consumer and prosumer for years, thinks we’re about to see a shift in how consumers spend time online, with AI powering “concierge-like” services. The question is, will legacy consumer products […]

item.title: Average organization now reporting over 200 GenAI-related data policy violations each month
item.description: Shadow AI remains a key challenge for organizations as employees share more and more sensitive data with unvetted tools.

item.title: Niko is a robotic lift for people with limited mobility that doesn't require a caregiver's help
item.description: A startup called ReviMo has developed a robotic system that provides a way for people with limited mobility to lift and transfer themselves — like from a bed to a wheelchair, or to the toilet — without the assistance of a caregiver. ReviMo's Niko has two sets of arms: one that forms a "scooping seat" that slides underneath the person to lift them up, and the other encircling their torso and providing a backrest. It can be operated both by remote and using the controls on its dashboard. Niko in its current iteration can carry up to 250 pounds, but the team says it's working on a version that ca...

item.title: Anthropic reportedly raising $10B at $350B valuation
item.description: Anthropic is reportedly in talks to raise $10 billion at a $350 billion valuation, marking its third mega-round in a year.

item.title: Amazon’s smart shopping cart for Whole Foods gets bigger, lighter, and adds tap-to-pay
item.description: Amazon is launching a revamped version of its smart shopping cart, which it plans to bring to dozens of Whole Foods locations by the end of this year, according to an announcement on Wednesday. The new Dash Cart features a "more responsive" item scanner that's now located next to the built-in display, along with a […]
